entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 08 at 5:40AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow Continues Through Tonight... Much of the Eastern Interior, including Fairbanks, will receive an additional 1 to 2 inches of snow through tonight. Many roads may become snow covered and slippery. Snow will taper off tonight.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Chatanika River Valley; Delta Junction; Eielson AFB and Salcha; Fairbanks Metro Area; Goldstream Valley and Nenana Hills; Tanana Flats; Two Rivers; Upper Chena River Valley

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 08 at 5:40AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow Continues Through Tonight... Areas along the Alaska Range will receive an additional 3 to 5 inches, with the highest totals south of Denali Park. Northeast winds gusting to 25 mph will cause blowing and drifting snow in many areas today. Passes and Highway Summits will have winds gusting to 35 mph and low visibility in blowing snow. Many roads
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northern Denali Borough; Southern Denali Borough

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued October 08 at 5:25AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 AM AKDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The following area, near Antler River. * WHEN...Until 1145 AM AKDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
entry.cap:areaDesc: City and Borough of Juneau

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 08 at 4:47AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow and Strong Winds Monday and Tuesday... The Arctic coast from Prudhoe Bay east will see between 3 and 5 inches of accumulating snow on Monday and Tuesday. Strong east winds of 30 to 35 mph will blow this falling snow and could temporarily result in periods of low visibility. Use caution when traveling.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Beaufort Sea Coast; Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast

entry.summary: ...DANGEROUS FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS SUNDAY AFTERNOON... entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued October 08 at 9:01AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT FOR ELEVATED OZONE AIR POLLUTION... The Imperial County APCD has issued an air quality alert in the Imperial Valley due to high levels of ozone (smog). The air quality alert is in effect until 8 PM on Sunday, October 8, 2023. Elevated levels of ozone – the predominant summertime pollutant – are likely to result in poor air quality in the afternoon and early-
entry.cap:areaDesc: Imperial Valley

entry.summary: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Coastal Palm Beach County. * WHEN...Through Monday evening. * IMPACTS...Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 08 at 9:50AM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Volusia and Lake Counties. .The Saint Johns River at Astor has fallen from Moderate to Minor Flood Stage. The river is forecast to gradually decline through Minor Flood Stage over the next week. For the St. Johns River...including Astor...Minor flooding is
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lake; Volusia

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 08 at 4:11AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ELEVATED FIRE WEATHER DANGER TODAY... Very dry conditions on top of ongoing drought will lead to elevated fire weather danger today. While not quite meeting red flag criteria due to lighter winds than yesterday, burning is still not recommended.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 08 at 2:59AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: HIGH FIRE DANGER CONDITIONS THIS AFTERNOON INTO THE EVENING FOR CENTRAL GEORGIA DUE TO LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITIES... Relative Humidities of 25 percent or less can be expected for 4 or more hours this afternoon into the evening. Winds will be NW at 5 to 10 MPH with gusts up to 15 MPH.
